key_risks: Supply chain vulnerabilities, including delays in receiving equipment and parts
Economic sensitivity tied to construction activity and consumer spending
Regulatory risks from changes in environmental regulations
Competition from other distributors and regional players
controversies: Unfavorable settlement in the Regional Standards Lawsuit
Employee reviews indicating internal challenges and management perceptions
environmental_issues: Transition to refrigerants with a global warming potential (GWP) below 750 by January 2025
social_issues: Perceptions of management and lack of clarity in the company’s software-focused strategy
governance_issues: Potential internal cultural challenges and management perceptions

sources.title: Spotlight on sustainability: Watsco - stewartinvestors.com
sources.snippet: Watsco is transitioning it's HVAC equipment with alternative refrigerants in compliance with the Aim Act 2020. The act addresses the phasedown use of hydrochlorofluorocarbons (HFCs) and requires refrigerants to have less than 750 global warming potential, by January 2025.
